intro: Lantana crocea var. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemala lantana, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, brightly colored flowers, typically yellow or orange. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
